slug: /214
title: "This Week In React #214: Base UI, Custom Elements, Next.js, React Router, TanStack, i18n, OG, Apollo, Android XR, iOS targets, Nitro, RNTL, Volume Manager, Drag Select, brownfield, Zod, Node, SourceMaps, Bun, State Of JS..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 12-18-2024
---

## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
[![Base UI 1.0 alpha](/emails/issues/214/base-ui.jpg)](https://base-ui.com/)
[**Base UI 1.0 alpha**](https://base-ui.com/)

Iâ€™m usually not into UI libs. But when Radix, MUI and Floating UI creators gather to create a new set of 25 unstyled, accessible, composable primitive components with great care to details, I think itâ€™s worth paying attention\! Radix is super popular these days (notably thanks to shadcn/ui), but has been [less actively maintained](https://github.com/radix-ui/primitives/graphs/contributors) recently, and a new headless lib challenger is always welcome\!

Mais quand les crÃ©ateurs de Radix, MUI et Floating UI s'unissent pour crÃ©er un nouvel ensemble de 25 composants primitifs non stylisÃ©s, accessibles et composables avec un grand souci du dÃ©tail, je pense que Ã§a mÃ©rite attention ! Radix est trÃ¨s populaire ces jours-ci (notamment grÃ¢ce Ã  shadcn/ui), mais a Ã©tÃ© [moins activement maintenu](https://github.com/radix-ui/primitives/graphs/contributors) rÃ©cemment, et un nouveau challenger de bibliothÃ¨que headless est toujours le bienvenu !
translations.en: Je ne suis gÃ©nÃ©ralement pas fan des bibliothÃ¨ques d'UI. Mais quand les crÃ©ateurs de Radix, MUI et Floating UI s'unissent pour crÃ©er un nouvel ensemble de 25 composants primitifs non stylÃ©s, accessibles et composables avec un grand souci du dÃ©tail, je pense que Ã§a mÃ©rite attention\! Radix est trÃ¨s populaire actuellement (notamment grÃ¢ce Ã  shadcn/ui), mais a Ã©tÃ© [moins activement maintenu](https://github.com/radix-ui/primitives/graphs/contributors) rÃ©cemment, et un nouveau challenger de librairie headless est toujours bienvenu\!

segments.source_content: **React 19 and Custom Elements**
Various related articles I found interesting:

translations.fr: Divers articles connexes que j'ai trouvÃ©s intÃ©ressants :
translations.en: DiffÃ©rents articles connexes que j'ai trouvÃ©s intÃ©ressants :

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“œ [React 19 and Web Component Examples](https://frontendmasters.com/blog/react-19-and-web-component-examples/): Chris Coyier testing React 19 custom elements support by creating a Lit element and rendering it though JSX. You can seamlessly pass an object as props, but for event handlers you may need to dispatch a custom event.
- ğŸ“œ [React 19 introduces full support for custom elements](https://aleks-elkin.github.io/posts/2024-12-06-react-19/): Comparing support improvement between React 18 and React 19\.
- ğŸ“œ [Sweet Suspense](https://plainvanillaweb.com/blog/articles/2024-09-09-sweet-suspense/): Fun experiment recreating React lazy/Suspense/ErrorBoundary with custom elements.
- ğŸ“œ [Isomorphic Web Components](https://jakelazaroff.com/words/isomorphic-web-components/): Not using React, but a useful overview of server-side rendering support for Web components.

- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR \- `unstable_rootParams()`](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/72837): A new convenient experimental API to return path params from all path segments up to the root layout. Looks particularly useful for accessing a i18n `[locale]` param.
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR \- `experimental.newDevOverlay`](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/73977): A new dev overlay is coming and the feature flag already exists.
- ğŸ‘€ [Rsbuild PR \- plugin-react-router](https://github.com/web-infra-dev/rsbuild/pull/4186): React Router framework features (Remix) are now implemented as a Vite plugin, but it seems other bundlers could also turn React Router into a framework ğŸ˜²
- ğŸ„ [GitHub Unwrapped 2024](https://githubunwrapped.com/): The Remotion-based project has just been update for 2024.
- ğŸ“œ [How to validate your React i18next application](https://lingual.dev/blog/how-to-validate-your-react-i18next-application/): Present a workflow based on react-i18next to prevent missing, unused, and invalid translation keys. Thereâ€™s another post for react-intl users.
- ğŸ“œ [Rails \+ Stimulus \+ React \- The definitive way to integrate](https://blog.codeminer42.com/rails-stimulus-react/): Using Stimulus data attributes to mount a React autocomplete component on a Rails page.

- ğŸ“œ [5 tips to effectively optimize INP in React](https://calendar.perfplanet.com/2024/5-tips-to-effectively-optimize-inp-in-react/): Reduce DOM size, split components, use Suspense, avoid hydration errors, pay attention to useEffect that can be synchronous.

New features: async requests, deferred props, prefetching, polling.
- ğŸ“¦ [Apollo Client 3.12 \- GraphQL fragment data masking](https://www.apollographql.com/blog/more-resilient-code-with-data-masking-in-apollo-client-3-12): Similar to Relay, Apollo Client improves in colocation, encapsulation, and performance. A component will only receive the fields it needs, and nothing more.
